XC584006-Mangrove Blue Flycatcher-calls-4-Xeno-Matang Forest Reserve, Perak, Malaysia-20th August 2020.mp3
rmk: I saw 3 Mangrove Blue Flycatchers at this site; one a pair and another time a single adult female. These birds are easily missed in the shadows of the mangrove forest unless heard singing. I heard both male and female birds sing. Songs have much variation. The basic structure is described by Wells (2007) as ‘dee dah fee po’, but many more complex and longer songs are also give and were heard. Songs are usually given 2-5 seconds apart and have a duration of 1.25-1.75 seconds. I also noted a clicking-like noise to show displeasure.
in mangrove forest, close to ground
Bird had been in area for at least two weeks prior. The bird was well seen and sang sub-songs in the mangrove undergrowth. It incorporated songs of Oriental Magpie Robins into its sub-song.
